message: What should be done to convey these values according to you?
Hi, I am the developer behind http://TaskArmy.com
The values I want to express: simplicity. quality. frictionless.
Because I come from a dev background, I am looking for designers' feedback on my website.
"Buy services like if you were at the supermarket."  sounds a bit awkward
^ i concur
Then you scroll down and details are broken down succinctly.

So, I'd review what the key messages are, put them in hierarchical order, then give them the weight according to that, and you'll probably already be on the way to an easier to read and navigate homepage. Hope that helps!
There's a lot going on on the page, which doesn't denote simplicity. Also everything has the same 'visual weight' so it's hard to know where to look first, second, third.
Take a look at http://www.taskforceapp.com/
I'd move the list of example services from the "Browse Existing Services" dropdown to a tabled list below the main box, that way you can see what type of services you mean right away
services is one of the vaguest words
When you first look at the page, you're given a statement / description of the product and what it does, as well as a screenshot of what you're getting. Simple
I'd list some online services - it's a bit ambiguous. Took me a while to figure out what is in this virtual supermarket.
Especially in the online sense. There are *so many* online servies.
@dmix Awesome solution, thanks!
@dmix services -> "Website related tasks"?
@spencer "same visual weight" How do you change the weight of the different elements of the landing page? I thought the position of the elements would be enough?
@snsr Thank you. I am french so copywriting is certainly not my strength. How would you explain that it is like an AppStore for services?
@aymericg scale comes into it too, but positioning is key to suggesting hierarchy

@AymericG "How would you explain that it is like an AppStore for services?"  I think the word 'services' doesn't adequately convey what you're indexing.  'Independent workforce' or maybe 'outsourcing marketplace'?
came across a good site similar to yours http://www.resourcenation.com/
see the most popular categories? thats what I was talking about to quickly communicate the options
@AymericG there's a lot going on, I would wonder if that makes your conversion rates drop
@dmix Thanks for the link, I didn't know them and they look to have many similar aspects
@alexbaldwin And I have trimmed a lot! :) I guess I could have some sort of Google homepage?
@AymericG I don't know if you want that minimalist, but just think about the main action you are trying to get people to do and don't distract them from that
@spencer Thank you. I will try to explain some use cases for TaskArmy. I thought showing some of the popular services would sufficiently explain what it does
@spencer @alexbaldwin @dmix @snsr I have updated the landing page a bit to reflect some of your recommendations. Please let me know if it looks better -> http://taskarmy.com/
@AymericG way better - I see what services are offered straight away.
much better, I understood what the site was about within seconds and actually clicked through to the listings
Thank you everyone!
